resources.string: The Emancipation Proclamation officially takes effect.
Georgia becomes the fourth state to join the Union.
United States severs diplomatic relations with Cuba.
Nixon refuses to hand over tapes that had been subpoenaed.
Construction begins on the Golden Gate Bridge.
Samuel Morse unveils his telegraph.
First US presidential election is held.
George Washington delivers first State of the Union.
Thomas Paine publishes Common Sense.
First meeting of the United Nations.
Theodore Roosevelt makes the Grand Canyon a national monument.
Ophelia Caraway of Arkansas becomes first female senator.
LBJ appoint Robert Weaver as the first black cabinet member.
Continental Congress ratifies the Treaty of Paris ending the Revolution.
Packers face Chiefs in first Super Bowl.
Prohibition takes effect.
In fairwell address Eisenhower warns of "military industrial complex".
Thomas Jefferson requests funds for Lewis and Clark.
Edgar Allen Poe is born.
The Iran Hostage Crisis ends.
President Carter pardons Vietnam draft dodgers.
Court upholds right to abortions in Roe v. Wade.
Toy company Wham-O produces first frisbees.
First canned beer goes on sale.
Inaugural Emmy awards ceremony is held.
Tennessee passes first prohibition law.
Americans bomb Germans for the first time.
Failed Challenger launch occurs resulting in the death of all astronauts on board.
Baseball Hall of Fame inducts inaugural class.
Maryland becomes final state to ratify the Articles of Confederation.
Truman announces the development of a hydrogen bomb.
First session of the U.S. Supreme Court takes place.
Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo is signed ending the Mexico-American War.
Clinton ends Vietnam trade embargo.
Washington unanimously elected by Electoral College.
FDR begins his "court packing" scheme to push New Deal policies.
John Steinbeck publishes "Of Mice and Men".
The Beatles arrive in America for the first time.
Dawes Act signed, breaking up Native American reserve lands.
US sends first combat troops to South Vietnam.
Child Star Shirley Temple passed away.
Emma Goldman, birth control pioneer arrested in New York.
Congress passes first fugitive slave law.
LBJ approves Operation Rolling Thunder.
Teddy Roosevelt\'s wife and daughter urelatedly die hours apart.
Navy ship, the Maine, explodes leading to the Spanish-American War.
American troops recapture Bataan in the Pihlippines.
Senate passes the Missouri Compromise.
Mark Twain publishes "The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn".
Aaron Burr is arrested for treason.
Photographer Ansel Adams is born.
Malcolm X is assassinated.
US hockey defeats Soviet Union in miracle on ice.
US flag raised on Iwo Jima.
Marbury v. Madison establishes judicial review.
Hiram Revels from Mississippi becomes first black congressman.
Trayvon Martin is shot and killed.
The first Mardi Gras in New Orleans.
Watson and Crick discover chemical structure of DNA.
Hank Aaron signs $200,000 deal, a record for the time.
Charles Lindbergh\'s child is kidnapped.
Dr. Seuss is born.
Freedman\'s Bureau is created to protect freed slaves.
FDR is inaugurated.
The Boston Massacre occurs.
Bayer patents aspirin.
Alexander Graham Bell patents the telephone.
Beavis and Butthead premiers.
Barbie makes her debut at the American Toy Fair.
Lincoln appoints Ulysses S. Grant to command the US army.
Congress establishes the US Army Corps of Engineers.
FDR gives first fireside chat.
Impeachment trial of Andrew Johnson begins.
Albert Einstein is born.
"The Godfather" opens in theaters.
US Military Academy established at West Point.
First St. Patrick\'s Day Parade in NYC.
Wells Fargo is established as a shipping and banking company.
War in Iraq begins.
LBJ sends federal troops to Alabama to ensure fair election.
March from Selma to Montgomery for voting equality begins.
Stamp Act imposed on American colonies.
"The Titanic" wins 11 Academy Awards.
Peyton Manning is born.
Triangle Shirtwaist Fire kills 145.
First antiwar demonstration in Washington since Nixon\'s inauguration.
FDA approves Viagra.
Dwight Eisenhower passes away.
US withdraws from Vietnam.
President Reagan is shot.
President Johnson announces halt of bombing in Vietnam for peace talks.
First US Congress elects Frederick Conrad as first Speaker of House.
Wilson asks Congress for a declaration of war against Germany.
Truman signs Foreign Assistance Act, AKA the Marshall Plan.
MLK is assassinated in Memphis, Tennessee.
Kurt Cobain commits suicide.
Joseph Smith establishes the Mormon Church.
Eisenhower gives "domino theory" speech.
Hank Aaron sets new homerun record with 715th HR.
Robert E. Lee surrenders at Appomattox Courthouse.
US Table Tennis team visits China.
France makes initial offer to sell Louisiana.
The Civil War begins.
Tiger Woods wins his first major.
Abraham Lincoln is shot at Ford\'s Theater.
Jackie Robinson breaks baseball\'s color barrier.
Benard Baruch coins the term "Cold War"
The Ford Mustang debuts at World\'s Fair.
The Great San Francisco Earthquake kills 3,000.
First Boston Marathon is held.
Robert E. Lee resigns from US Army, joins Confederacy.
Naturalist John Muir is born.
The Oklahoma land rush begins.
Ford says that the Vietnam War is over for the US.
John Adams establishes the Library of Cognress.
Truman inaugurates White House bowling alley.
Polio vaccine trials begin.
The Tea Act is passed in Parliament
Nixon approves Cambodian incursion
World War II monument opens in Washington D.C.
Louisiana Purchase concluded for $15 million.
Empire State Building dedicated.
Osama Bin Laden killed.
Paris chosen as city for peace talks in Vietnam War.
The Haymarket Square Riot occurs in Chicago after a bomb is thrown.
Spider-Man becomes the first movie to top $100 million in opening weekend.
The Hindenburg explodes in New Jersey.
Pontiac\'s Rebellion begins.
Knicks defeat Lakers to win first NBA championship.
FDA approves the birth-control pill.
J. Edgar Hoover begins with the FBI, then Bureau of Investigation.
Minnesota enters the Union.
Body of Lindbergh baby found.
President Polk declares war on Mexico.
Lewis and Clark depart on expedition.
Governor George Wallace is shot during a presidential campaign rally.
First Academy Awards ceremony.
Brown v. Board of Ed is decided.
Plessy v. Ferguson is decided.
Churchill and FDR begin to plot D-Day.
Levi Strauss receives patent for blue jeans.
The American Red Cross is founded.
Southern congreesman attacks Northern senator over slavery.
Police kill famous outlaws Bonnie and Clyde.
Brooklyn Bridge opens.
Star Wars opens.
Model T ceases production.
The Golden Gate Bridge opens.
Baseball owners allow Dodgers and Giants to move to CA.
Wisconsin enters the Union.
First Indy 500 is held.
Mark Felt is revealed to be Deep Throat, of Watergate fame.
CNN officially launches.
Babe Ruth retires.
John Adams becomes the first president to reside in the White House.
Congress passes the 19th Amendment, for women\'s suffrage.
FDR takes the US off the gold standard.
D-Day takes place off the shores of Normandy.
Bo Jackson is drafted by the Kansas City Royals.
FBI report names Hollywoo figures as communists.
Secretariat wins the Triple Crown.
Franklin flies kite during thunderstorm demonstrating electricity.
University of Alabama is desegregated.
Virginia adopts George Mason\'s Declaration of Rights.
Miranda rights are established through Miranda v. Arizona.
Congress adopts the Stars and Stripes flag.
US-Canadian border established.
First roller coaster in America opens on Coney Island.
The Statue of Liberty arrives in New York Harbor.
The War of 1812 begins.
Rosenbergs are executed for allegedly passing atomic secrets to the Soviets.
Blockbuster film Jaws released.
U.S. Constitution officially ratified.
FDR signs the G.I. Bill to support veterans.
Title IX enacted preventing discrimination on sex.
Senate passes landmark auto safety bill.
The Korean War begins.
Congress approves Federal Highway Act.
Mormon leader Joseph Smith killed by mob.
Stonewall Riots begin in favor of gay rights.
Supreme Court strikes down death penalty, later to be overturned.
The first Corvette built.
The Battle of Gettysburg begins
LBJ signs the Civil Rights Act of 1964.
The Battle of Gettysburg ends.
The US declares independence. Happy 4th!
1919 White Sox team accused of throwing World Series.
Forrest Gump opens in theaters.
Building of the Hoover Dam begins.
Liberty Bell tolls to announce Declaration of Independence.
New York elects its first governor.
U.S. patent issued for three-point seatbelt.
Aaron Burr slays Hamilton in duel.
Eisenhower becomes first president to take a helicopter ride.
Congress enacts the Northwest Ordinance for settlement of the NW.
Sedition Act becomes federal law.
Ford Motors takes its first order.
Atom bomb successfully tested in New Mexico.
Disneyland opens.
FDR nominated for unprecedented third term.
Seneca Falls Convention begins for woman\'s rights.
Neil Armstrong becomes the first man on the moon.
Scopes trial draws national attention on legality of teaching evolution.
Cannibal and serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer is caught.
Detroit Riots begin, would become most destructive and violents riot in US history.
After 17 months of travel, Mormons settle in Salt Lake City.
Congress asserts that Civil War is waged for reunion and not to intefere with southern "institutions".
US postal system is established.
House begins impeachment process of Nixon.
14th Amendment adopted, guaranteeing blacks US citizenship.
NASA is created.
LBJ signs Medicare into law.
Teamsters Union president Jimmy Hoffa vanishes.
MTV launches with John Lack\'s, the creator of the network, first words \"Ladies and gentelman, rock and roll.\"
The Declaration of Independence is officially signed in person by 56 delegates.
The NBA is born.
General Custer fights his first battle with Native Americans in Montana.
Marilyn Monroe found dead nude in a room of empty pill bottles.
American bomber drops atomic bomb on Hiroshima
George Washington creates "The Purple Heart" as a badge for military merit.
President Nixon resigns, becoming the first ever president to do so.
Jerry Garcia, of Grateful Dead fame, dies.
Smithsonia Institution created to "increase a diffusion of knowledge"
The first federal prisoners land on Alcatraz Island.
The Wizard of Oz movie premieres in Oconomowoc, Wisconsin.
New York Yankee legend Mickey Mantle dies.
FDR signed the Social Security Act into law.
The Woodstock festival opens in Bethel, New York.
A plane crash at Detroit Metropolitan Airport in Michigan kills 156 people.
Billy the Kids kills his first man. His first victim was an Arizona blacksmith.
The 19th Amendment, guaranteeing women the right to vote, is ratified.
The first race is held at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway, now home to the Indy 500.
First around-the-world telegram is sent form the New York Times office through Beijing.
Hawaii becomes the 50th state through President Eisenhower\'s proclomation.
Nolan Ryan becomes the first MLB pitcher to register 5,000 strikeouts.
Sacco and Vanzetti are executed for murder, despite evidence for their innocence.
The British capture and burn Washington D.C. during the War of 1812.
John Birch is captured and killed by communists, regarded as first casualty of Cold War.
First televised MLB game between the Cincinnati Reds and the Brooklyn Dodgers.
Lyndon B. Johnson is born
Riots in Chicago breakout over whether the DNC should continue to support the Vietnam War.
Hurricane Katrina hits land.
Thurgood Marshall becomes the first Black justice on the Supreme Court.
General Sherman launches his Scorched Earth campaign in Atlanta.
Atlanta falls to General Sherman and the Union Troops
World\'s first ATM opens for business in Rockville Center, New York.
The Treaty of Paris is officially signed bringing an end to the American Revolution.
Google founders Larry Paige and Sergey Brin file for incorporation in California.
Sam Houston is elected president of Texas after gaining its independence.
President William McKinley is shot by anarchist Leon Czolgosz.
United States earns the nickname "Uncle Sam" from a meat packer.
Gerald Ford pardons Richard Nixon for crimes he committed as president.
The Continental Congress formally declares the name of the new nation "United States of America"
John Smith is elected council president of Jamestown Viriginia.
Multiple terrorist-hijacked planes attack the World Trade Center and the Pentagon.
JFK marries Jacqueline Bouvier
Francis Scott Key pens the Star-Spangled Banned after the British attack on Fort McHenry.
President McKinley dies days after getting shot from infection in wounds.
Mohammad Ali defeats Leon Spinks to become to win third heavyweight boxing title.
William Durant spends $2000 to incorporate General Motors in New Jersey.
The Battle of Antietam begins marking the end of General Lee\'s first Northern Invasion.
Jimmy Carter files a report claiming he had seen a UFO.
Nevada is the site of the first-ever underground nuclear explosion.
JFK proposes a joint mission with the Soviet Union to send a man to the moon.
Benedict Arnold commits treason by handing West Point over to the British.
Lincoln issues the Emancipation Proclomation.
President Truman informs the people that the Soviets have a nuclear bomb.
The Judiciary Act of 1789 is passed paving the way for the first Supreme Court.
Central High School is integrated in Little Rock, Arkansas.
Kennedy-Nixon debate becomes the first televised presidential debate.
Soviet Premier Nikita Khrushchev ends his two week visit to the United States
Ted Williams, a member of Boston Red Sox, become the last player to bat .400 in a season.
Willie Mays makes famous over the shoulder catch in Game 1 of 1954 World Series.
James Dean dies in car crash at the age of 24.
Yosemite National Park is established after John Muir\'s campaign for its protection.
President Woodrow Wilson suffers a massive stroke leaving him partially paralyzed.
O.J. Simpson is acquitted of murder charges.
Pope Paul VI visits the US becoming the first sitting pope to do so.
President Truman delivers the first ever televised presidential address.
First ever train robbery is carried out in Reno, Nevada.
Arnold Schwarzenegger becomes California governor.
Great Chicago Fire begins. The fire would eventually kill between 200 and 300 people.
Roger Williams is banished from Massachusetts, leading to the founding of Rhode Island.
Vice President Spiro Agnew resigns.
Jimmy Carter wins Nobel Prize for decades of peaceful service.
Christopher Columbus reaches the New World.
The Continental Congress authorizes the first naval force.
The Cuban Missile Crisis begins, pitting the Soviet Union and the US on the brink of nuclear conflict.
In demonstration against the Vietnam War the first public burning of a draft card takes place.
John Brown\'s anti-slavery raid on Harpers Ferry, Virginia takes place.
Al Capone is sentenced to 11 years of prison for tax evasion.
The US takes possession of Alaska in transaction known as Seward\'s Folley.
The first Blockbuster store opens in Dallas, Texas.
Congressional committee begins investigating Communist influence in Hollywood.
Guggenheim Museum opens in New York City.
Kennedy announces blockade of Cuba during the Missile Crisis.
An abortion performing doctor, Dr. Slepian, is murdered by anti-abortion radicals.
The George Washington Bridge between NY and NJ is dedicated and opened.
Under Reagan\'s orders The United States invades Grenada.
The Eeerie Canal connecting the Great Lakes with the Atlantic Ocean officially opens.
New York City subway opens.
The Gateway Arch in St. Louis is completed.
John Hancock resigns as president of Congress due to illness.
President Eisenhower approves NSC 162/2 which made clear that the US nuclear arsenal was to be maintained against Communist threat.
Harry Houdini dies of peritonitis in a Detroit hospital.
British Parliament enacts the Stamp Act to raise revenue after the French and Indian War.
Truman defeats Dewey after polls overwhelmingly predicted a Dewey presidency.
D.C. residents cast their first presidential votes after the passing of the 23rd Amendment.
Barack Obama is elected as America\'s first black president.
Abraham Lincoln removes General McClellan from command of the Union Army.
Jefferson Davis is elected president of the Confederacy.
FDR becomes the first president to be elected for a thrid term.
JFK is elected president
General Burnside assumes command of the Union Army after Lincoln removed McClellan.
Sesame Street debuts.
World War I ends.
Ellis Island shuts its doors after processing more than 12 million immigrants.
The Vietnam Veterans Memorial is dedicated in Washington D.C.
Apollo 12 launches, becoming the second manned mission to the surface of the moon.
The first stock ticker debuts in New York City.
Notre Dame ends Oklahoma\'s record 47 game winning streak.
The Articles of Confederation are submitted to the states for approval.
Lincoln boards a train for Gettysburg in the aftermath of the bloodiest battle of the Civil War.
Lincoln delivers the Gettysburg Address.
New Jersey ratifies the Bill of Rights, becoming the first state to do so.
Thomas Edison announces his invention of the phonograph.
John F. Kennedy is assassinated in Dallas, Texas.
Boss Tweed delivered to authorities after his capture in Spain.
"Hollywoo 10" cited for contempt of Congress for not participating in Communism investigation.
The final British soldiers leave New York after the signing of the Treaty of Paris
FDR establishes Thanksgiving as a federal holiday.
Jimi Hendrix is born in Seattle
Daily Show host Jon Steward is born.
LBJ forms commission to investigate Kennedy assassination.
Brady Bill is signed making five day background checks mandatory to purchase a handgun.
Henry Ford\'s assembly line begins production in Detroit.
Monroe Doctrine declared, asserting US neutrality in European affairs.
Washington arrives on the banks of the Delaware, where the famous painting takes place.
Senate approves U.S. participation in the United Nations.
Prohibition Ends with the ratification of the 21st Amendment.
The Washington Monument is completed in D.C.
Pearl Harbor is bombed by the Japanese.
John Lennon is shot in New York.
John Birch society founded to fight infiltration of communism into American society.
Treaty of Paris ends the Spanish-American War.
Bernie Madoff arrested for running a ponzi-scheme involving $65 billion.
Pennsylvania becomes the second state to ratify the Constitution.
Al Gore concedes the presidential election after Gore v. Bush ruled in favor of Bush.
Gunman kills students and adults at Newtown Connecticut elementary school.
The Bill of Rights officially becomes law after Virginia ratifies the amendments.
The Boston Tea Party occurs.
The first airplane takes flight in Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.
The Mayflower docks at Plymouth Harbor.
President Clinton is impeached for lying under oath to a grand jury.
Michael Moore\'s first film \'Roger and Me\' opens.
\'The Graduate\' opens in theaters.
LA Lakers break previous long winning streak of 27 games, would go on to win 33 straight games.
George Washington resigns as commander in chief after the signing of the Treaty of Paris.
The War of 1812 ends after the signing of the Treaty of Ghent.
Washington leads troops on raid at Trenton, New Jersey.
President Harry Truman dies in Independence, Missouri.
Radio City Music Hall opens in New York City.
Woodrow Wilson born in Staunton, Virginia.
US Army massacres Indians at Wounded Knee.
Fire breaks out in Chicago theater. The fire killed more than 600 people.
Happy New Year
